lead_paragraph: The Finance Ministry finally admitted what every economist, stockbroker and reader of the business pages has long suspected: India's growth rate will likely fall short of 8 percent this year. The global slowdown, rising oil and commodity prices and rising interest rates are to blame, Pranab Mukherjee, India's finance minister, said Wednesday. The lower expectations will have a major impact on the best-case-scenario budget presented earlier this year, which assumed the treasury would overflow with the proceeds of a white-hot economy (Mint).

headline.main: Newswallah: In the English-Language Press Thursday
